intro: Androsace glabrata, commonly known as the smooth sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to alpine environments. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and is often found in high-altitude habitats. Androsace glabrata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
